remarks: Anything finite product containing a zero term is itself zero. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 27-Dec-2017.)
statement:
fprodeq0.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
fprodeq0.2 $e |- ( ph -> N e. Z ) $.
fprodeq0.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> A e. CC ) $.
fprodeq0.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k = N ) -> A = 0 ) $.
fprodeq0 $p |- ( ( ph /\ K e. ( ZZ>= ` N ) ) -> prod_ k e. ( M ... K ) A = 0 ) $.
$d K k $.
$d M k $.
$d N k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
